intro: Rhynchospora oligantha var. typica, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to wetlands and marshy areas in North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, grass-like leaves and dense, spike-like inflorescences. Its flowers are small and clustered, with three stamens and a three-lobed pistil, characteristic of the sedge family. It plays an important ecological role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various invertebrates and birds.
